fields.headline: Pricewatch
fields.bodyText: · The price of the average home in the South East has gone up by 12.3 per cent over the last year to £196,165, says the Halifax. · Average sale prices were 93.4 per cent of the asking prices in the month to mid-September, says Hometrack. Properties took an average of 6.3 weeks to sell after an average 12.3 viewings. · Rents averaged £732 per calendar month in July for furnished properties, according to the Royal Institution of Chartered Surveyors. One-bedroom flats averaged £583, two-beds £690, three-bed semis £850 and four-bed detached homes £1,200. · Surrey suffered the largest drop in prices among the counties in England and Wales in the month to mid-September - down by 0.4 per cent to an average of £240,800, according to Hometrack. Prices in Berkshire fell an average of 0.3 per cent in the month to mid-September to average £217,600.
